 131: static struct _cydecimal _mult_decimals(const struct _cydecimal first, const struct _cydecimal second) {
 132:     exponent_t i, j, place_val=0;
 133:     const bool negate = first.negative ^ second.negative;
 134:     char overflow, x, y, temp;
 135:     
 136:     struct _cydecimal result = _empty_decimal();
 137: 
 138:     // Initialize result digits to zero
 139:     //memset(result.digits, 0, sizeof(result.digits));
 140:     
 141:     _normalize_digits(&first, true);
 142:     _normalize_digits(&second, true);
 143: 
 144: 
 145:     if (second.exp < first.exp){ // we want to minimize the exp, so that it stays an integer
 146:         _left_shift_digits(&first, (first.exp-second.exp));
 147:     }
 148:     else if (second.exp > first.exp){ // we want to minimize the exp, so that it stays an integer
 149:         _left_shift_digits(&second, (second.exp-first.exp));
 150:     }
 151:     result.exp = first.exp + second.exp;
 152:     result.negative = negate;
 153:     //printf("Printing... %s %s \\n", _dec_2_str(first), _dec_2_str(second));
 154:     for (i = N_DIGITS_I; i > -1; i--) {
 155:         overflow = 0;
 156:         x = first.digits[i];
 157: 
 158:         if (x != 0) {
 159:             for (j = N_DIGITS_I; j > -1; j--) {
 160:                 y = second.digits[j];
 161: 
 162:                 if (y == 0 && overflow == 0) {
 163:                     continue;
 164:                 }
 165: 
 166:                 overflow = (x * y) + overflow + result.digits[j-place_val];
 167:                 temp = overflow;
 168:                 if ((overflow > 9)) {
 169:                     result.digits[j - place_val] = overflow % 10;
 170:                     overflow = overflow / 10;  // Integer division for carry-over
 171:                     //result.digits[j - place_val-1] = overflow //trying this
 172:                 } else {
 173:                     result.digits[j - place_val] = overflow;
 174:                     overflow = 0;
 175:                 }

 178: 
 179:

 183: 
 184:     _normalize_digits(&result, false);
 185:     if (_close_zero(&result) > -1){
 186:         return _empty_decimal();
 187:     }
 188:     return result;
 189: }

 192: static struct _cydecimal _decimal_from_double(double first) {
 193:     struct _cydecimal res;
 194:     res.negative = first < 0;
 195:     first = fabs(first);
 196:     double large = floor(first), small, temp;
 197:     small = first - large;  // decimal portion
 198:     temp = large;
 199:     iterable_t i;
 200:     unsigned char large_lim = (unsigned char)(floor(log10(fabs(large))) + 1);
 201: 
 202:     if ((large_lim > N_DIGITS)) {
 203:         large_lim = N_DIGITS;
 204:     }
 205: 
 206:     
 207:     
 208:     res.exp = 0;
 209:     memset(&res.digits, 0, MAX_LENGTH);
 210: 
 211:     for (i = 0; i < large_lim; i++) {
 212:         res.digits[N_DIGITS_I - i] = (char)fmod(temp, 10);
 213:         temp = floor(temp * 0.1);
 214:     }
 215: 
 216:     temp = fabs(small);
 217:     i = N_PRECISION;
 218:     while ((temp) != ceil((temp))) {
 219:         temp = (temp * 10);
 220:         res.digits[i] = (char)fmod(floor(temp), 10);
 221:         i++;
 222: 
 223:         if (i > MAX_INDICE) {
 224:             break;
 225:         }
 226:     }
 227: 
 228:     return res;
 229: }
 230:

 232: static struct _cydecimal _norm_decimal_from_double(double first) {
 233:     struct _cydecimal res;
 234:     res.negative = first < 0;
 235:     first = fabs(first);
 236:     iterable_t i;
 237:     unsigned char large_lim;
 238:     
 239:     res.exp = 0;
 240:     
 241:     memset(res.digits, 0, MAX_LENGTH);
 242: 
 243:     while (ceil(first) != first) {
 244:         res.exp--;
 245:         first = first * 10;
 246:     }
 247: 
 248:     large_lim = (unsigned char)ceil(log10(first) + 1);
 249: 
 250:     if (large_lim > N_DIGITS) {
 251:         large_lim = N_DIGITS_I;
 252:     }
 253: 
 254:     for (i = 0; i < large_lim; i++) {
 255:         res.digits[N_DIGITS_I - i] = (char)fmod(first, 10);
 256:         first = floor(first*0.1);
 257:     }
 258: 
 259:     return res;
 260: }

 262: static struct _cydecimal _norm_decimal_from_string(const char* first) {
 263:     struct _cydecimal res;
 264:     iterable_t length = strlen(first);
 265:     char* strtok_backup = (char*)malloc(length * sizeof(char));
 266:     memcpy(strtok_backup, first, length * sizeof(char));
 267: 
 268:     char* small = (char*)malloc(sizeof(char)*length);
 269:     char* small_copy = small;
 270:     small = strrchr(first, PERIOD);
 271:     
 272:     small = small + 1;
 273: 
 274:     char* large = (char*)malloc(sizeof(char)*length);
 275:     char* large_copy = large;
 276:     large = strtok(strtok_backup, ".");
 277: 
 278:     unsigned char large_len = strlen(large), small_len = strlen(small);
 279: 
 280:     char* large_norm = (char*)malloc(sizeof(char)*length);
 281:     char* large_norm_copy = large_norm;
 282:     large_norm = large;
 283:     free(strtok_backup);
 284: 
 285:     iterable_t i;
 286:     
 287: 
 288:     if (large_len > N_DIGITS) {
 289:         large_len = N_DIGITS;
 290:     }
 291: 
 292:     if ((small_len + large_len) > N_DIGITS) {
 293:         i = N_DIGITS - large_len;
 294: 
 295:         if (small_len > i) {
 296:             small_len = i;
 297:         }
 298:     }
 299: 
 300:     free(large_copy);
 301:     large_len = large_len + small_len;
 302: 
 303:     large_copy = (char*)malloc(large_len * sizeof(char));
 304:     char* final_large_cpy = large_copy;
 305:     memcpy(large_copy, large_norm, length * sizeof(char));
 306:     free(large_norm_copy);
 307: 
 308:     strcat(large_copy, small);
 309:     free(small_copy);
 310: 
 311:     res.exp = -small_len;
 312: 
 313:     memcpy(res.digits, (char*)calloc(MAX_LENGTH, sizeof(char)), MAX_LENGTH * sizeof(char));
 314:     char x;
 315:     res.negative=false;
 316:     if (large_copy[0] == '-'){
 317:         res.negative=true;
 318:         large_copy++;
 319:         large_len--;
 320:     }
 321:     for (i = 0; i < large_len; i++) {
 322:         x = large_copy[large_len - 1 - i];
 323:         //if (x=='-'){ // just check for negative :)
 324:             //res.negative=true;
 325:             //res.digits[N_DIGITS_I - i+1] = -res.digits[N_DIGITS_I - i+1];
 326:             //continue;
 327:         //}
 328:         res.digits[N_DIGITS_I - i] = large_copy[large_len - 1 - i] - ZERO;
 329:     }
 330: 
 331:     free(final_large_cpy);
 332: 
 333:     return res;
 334: }

 386: static struct _cydecimal _decimal_from_int(int first) {
 387:     struct _cydecimal res;

 389:     res.exp = 0;
 390:     iterable_t i;

 398:     for (i=0;i<large_lim;i++){
 399:         res.digits[N_DIGITS_I - i] = first % 10;
 400:         first = first/10;

 405: static struct _cydecimal _norm_decimal_from_int(int first) {
 406:     iterable_t i;
 407:     struct _cydecimal res;
 408:     res.negative = first < 0;
 409:     res.exp = 0;
 410:     first = abs(first);
 411:     iterable_t large_lim = (iterable_t)floor(log10(first) + 1);
 412: 
 413: 
 414:     memcpy(&res.digits, calloc(MAX_LENGTH, sizeof(char)), MAX_LENGTH);
 415:     
 416:     // test: 8204.172
 417:     for (i=0;i<large_lim;i++){
 418:         res.digits[N_DIGITS_I - i] = first % 10;

 422:     return res;

 424: 
 425: static struct _cydecimal _add_decimals();
 426: 
 427: static struct _cydecimal _subtract_decimals(struct _cydecimal first, struct _cydecimal second) {
 428:     exponent_t i;
 429:     char x, y, res=0;
 430:     bool small = false, negate = false, both=(first.negative && second.negative);
 431:     struct _cydecimal temp;
 432:     if (first.exp > second.exp){  // we want to BRING ALL DIGITS TO THE LEFT OF THE DECIMAL NOW
 433:         _left_shift_digits(&first, first.exp-second.exp);  // bring up value
 434:     }
 435:     else if (second.exp > first.exp){
 436:         _left_shift_digits(&second, second.exp-first.exp);  // bring up value, bring down exponent
 437:         //temp = second;
 438:         //second = first;
 439:         //first = temp;  // swap
 440:         //negate = true;
 441:     }
 442:     if (_less_than_digits(first, second) && (!both)){
 443:         temp = second;
 444:         second = first;
 445:         first = temp;  // swap
 446:         negate = true;
 447:     }
 448:     else if (_eq_digits(first, second)){
 449:         return _empty_decimal();
 450:     };
 451: 
 452:     if ((second.negative) && (!first.negative)){  // second is negative, first is positive, add values instead
 453:         _negate(&second); // used to be abs_dec
 454:         first = _add_decimals(first, second);
 455:         if (negate){
 456:             _negate(&first);
 457:         }
 458:         return first;  // more efficient
 459:     }
 460:     else if (first.negative && (!second.negative)){ // first is negative, second is positive -> add and returns negated value
 461:         //second = _abs_dec(second);
 462:         _negate(&first); // used to be abs_dec
 463:         first = _add_decimals(first, second);
 464:         _negate(&first);
 465:         
 466:         return first;
 467:     }
 468:     else if(both){
 469:         _negate(&second); // changed this on the 23rd mar, may have to switch back
 470:         _negate(&first);
 471:         //first = _subtract_decimals(second, first);
 472:         return _subtract_decimals(second, first);
 473:     }
 474: 
 475:     //printf("Subtract called!\\n");
 476:     //printf("%s %s %d %d testing lmao\\n", _dec_2_str(&first), _dec_2_str(&second), first.negative, second.negative);
 477:     for (i = MAX_INDICE; i > -1; i--){
 478:         y = second.digits[i];
 479:         x = first.digits[i];
 480:         
 481:         if ((res == 1) || ((x!=0) || (y!=0))) {
 482:             x = x - res;
 483:             y = y;
 484: 
 485:             small = x < y;
 486:             if (small){
 487:                 x+=10;
 488:             };
 489:             res = (x) - y;
 490: 
 491:             if (res > 9) {
 492:                 res = ((res) % 10);
 493:             } else {
 494:                 res = res;
 495:             }
 496: 
 497:             // if (negate) {
 498:             //     if (res != 0) {
 499:             //         index = i;
 500:             //     };
 501:             // };
 502: 
 503:             first.digits[i] = res;  // always positive
 504: 
 505:             res = small;
 506:         }
 507:     }
 508: 
 509:     if (negate) {
 510:         first.negative = true;
 511:     }
 512:     if (_close_zero(&first) > -1){
 513:         return _empty_decimal();
 514:     }
 515:     return first;
 516: }
 517: 
 518: static struct _cydecimal _add_decimals(struct _cydecimal first, struct _cydecimal second) {
 519:     iterable_t i;
 520:     if (first.exp > second.exp) {
 521:         _left_shift_digits(&first, (first.exp - second.exp));
 522:     } else if (second.exp > first.exp) {
 523:         _left_shift_digits(&second, second.exp - first.exp);
 524:     }
 525:     if (first.negative ^ second.negative){  // if either one is negative, essentially subtraction
 526:         if (second.negative){
 527:             _negate(&second);
 528:             return _subtract_decimals(first, second);
 529:         }
 530:         else{
 531:             _negate(&first);
 532:             first = _subtract_decimals(first, second);
 533:             _negate(&first);
 534:             return first;
 535:         }
 536:     }
 537:     else if (first.negative && second.negative){  // both are negative, add their absolute and returns its negative.
 538: 
 539:         first = _abs_dec(first);
 540:         second = _abs_dec(second);
 541: 
 542:         first = (_add_decimals(first, second));
 543:         _negate(&first);
 544:         return first;
 545:     }
 546: 
 547:     char overflow = 0, res = 0, z, y;
 548:     
 549:     for (i = MAX_LENGTH; i > 0; i--) {
 550:         y = second.digits[i-1];
 551:         z = first.digits[i-1];
 552: 
 553:         if ((overflow != 0) || ((z!=0) || (y!=0))) {
 554:             res = z + y + overflow;
 555:             overflow = res;
 556: 
 557:             if (overflow > 9) {
 558:                 overflow = overflow % 10;
 559:             }
 560: 
 561:             first.digits[i-1] = overflow;
 562:             overflow = (char)((res - overflow) * 0.1);
 563:         }
 564:     }
 565:     if (_close_zero(&first) > -1){
 566:         return _empty_decimal();
 567:     }
 568:     return first;
 569: }
 570: 
 571:     '''
 572:     const _cydecimal _decimal_from_double(const double first) noexcept nogil
 573:     const _cydecimal _norm_decimal_from_double(const double first) noexcept nogil
 574:     const _cydecimal _norm_decimal_from_string(const char* first) noexcept nogil
 575:     const _cydecimal _decimal_from_string(const char* first) noexcept nogil
 576:     const _cydecimal _decimal_from_int(int first) noexcept nogil
 577:     const _cydecimal _norm_decimal_from_int(int first) noexcept nogil
 578:     const _cydecimal _add_decimals(_cydecimal first, _cydecimal second) noexcept nogil
 579:     const _cydecimal _subtract_decimals(_cydecimal first, _cydecimal second) noexcept nogil
 580:     const _cydecimal _mult_decimals(const _cydecimal first, const _cydecimal second) noexcept nogil
 581:     const _cydecimal _mult_decimal_decimal_digit(const _cydecimal_ptr first, const _cydecimal_ptr second, const int number) noexcept nogil
 582:     const _cydecimal _square_decimal(const _cydecimal first) noexcept nogil
 583: 
 584: '''cdef char* _dec_2_str_cy(const _cydecimal_ptr dec) noexcept nogil:
 585:     cdef char* string = <char*>malloc(((MAX_LENGTH)+25)*sizeof(char))
 586:     cdef iterable_t i, x = 0, temp = cabs(dec.exp), temp2
 587:     if temp != 0:
 588:         temp2 = <iterable_t>floor(log10((temp))+1)
 589:     else:
 590:         temp2 = 1
 591:     for i in range(MAX_LENGTH):
 592:         if i == N_DIGITS:
 593:             string[i+x] = b'.'  # .
 594:             postincrement(x)
 595:         if dec.digits[i] >= 0:
 596:             string[i+x] = dec.digits[i]+ZERO
 597:             pass
 598:         else:
 599:             string[i] = NEGATIVE
 600:             postincrement(x)
 601:             string[i+x] = (-(dec.digits[i]))+ZERO
 602:     string[MAX_LENGTH+x] = CAPITAL_E # E
 603:     postincrement(x)
 604:     if temp != 0:
 605:         if dec.exp < 0:
 606:             string[MAX_LENGTH+x] = NEGATIVE  # -
 607:             postincrement(x)
 608:         for i in range(temp2):  # n of digits
 609:             string[MAX_LENGTH+x+i] = (temp%10)+ZERO
 610:             temp = <iterable_t>temp//10
 611:     else:
 612:         string[MAX_LENGTH+x] = ZERO  # set to zero
 613:     #realloc(string, sizeof(char)*(MAX_LENGTH+temp2+x+1))
 614:     string[MAX_LENGTH+temp2+x] = TERMINATOR
 615:     return string
 616: 
 617: cdef _cydecimal _norm_decimal_from_string_cy(const char* first) noexcept nogil:  # use in cases where you want to store the actual decimal by itself
 618:     cdef _cydecimal res
 619:     cdef iterable_t length = _strlen(first)
 620:     cdef char* strtok_backup = <char*>malloc(length*sizeof(char))
 621:     memcpy(strtok_backup, first, sizeof(first))
 622:     cdef char* small = <char*>malloc(sizeof(char)*length)
 623:     cdef char* small_copy = small
 624:     small = _strrchr(first, PERIOD)
 625:     small = small+1
 626:     cdef char* large = <char*>malloc(sizeof(char)*length)
 627:     cdef char* large_copy = large
 628:     large = _strtok(strtok_backup, b'.')
 629:     cdef char* large_norm = <char*>malloc(sizeof(char)*length)
 630:     cdef char* large_norm_copy = large_norm
 631:     large_norm = large
 632:     free(strtok_backup)
 633:     
 634:     cdef iterable_t i, large_len = _strlen(large), small_len = _strlen(small)
 635:     if large_len > N_DIGITS:
 636:         large_len = N_DIGITS  # prefer larger value over smaller, more precise
 637:     if (small_len+large_len) > N_DIGITS:
 638:         i = N_DIGITS-large_len
 639:         if small_len > i:
 640:             small_len = i # save any remaining space for the precise digits
 641:     free(large_copy)
 642:     large_len = large_len+small_len
 643:     large = <char*>malloc(sizeof(char)*(large_len))
 644:     large_copy = large
 645:     memcpy(&large, &large_norm, (length))
 646:     free(large_norm_copy)
 647:     _strcat(large, small)
 648:     free(small_copy)
 649:     res.exp = small_len  # increase precise digits
 650:     #cdef char[MAX_LENGTH] digits = <char*>malloc(sizeof(char)*MAX_LENGTH)   # alloc
 651:     #for i in range(MAX_LENGTH):
 652:     #    digits[i] = 0
 653:     
 654:     memcpy(&res.digits, <char*>calloc(MAX_LENGTH, sizeof(char)), MAX_LENGTH*sizeof(char))
 655:     
 656:     for i in range((large_len)-1, -1, -1):
 657:         res.digits[N_DIGITS_I-i] = large[(large_len)-1-i]-ZERO
 658:     free(large_copy)
 659:     
 660:     #memcpy(&res.digits, digits, sizeof(digits))
 661:     return res
 662: 
 663: cdef _cydecimal _decimal_from_string_cy(const char* first) noexcept nogil:  # use in cases where you want to store the actual decimal by itself
 664:     cdef _cydecimal res
 665:     cdef iterable_t length = _strlen(first)
 666:     res.exp = 0
 667:     cdef char* strtok_backup = <char*>malloc(length*sizeof(char))
 668:     memcpy(strtok_backup, first, sizeof(first))
 669:     cdef char* small = <char*>malloc(sizeof(char)*length)
 670:     cdef char* small_copy = small
 671:     small = _strrchr(first, PERIOD)
 672:     small = small+1
 673:     cdef char* large = <char*>malloc(sizeof(char)*length)
 674:     cdef char* large_copy = large
 675:     large = _strtok(strtok_backup, b'.')
 676:     free(strtok_backup)
 677:     
 678:     cdef iterable_t i, large_len = _strlen(large), small_len = _strlen(small)
 679:     #cdef char[MAX_LENGTH] digits = <char*>malloc(sizeof(char)*MAX_LENGTH)   # alloc
 680:     #for i in range(MAX_LENGTH):
 681:     #    digits[i] = 0
 682:     memcpy(&res.digits, <char*>calloc(MAX_LENGTH, sizeof(char)), MAX_LENGTH*sizeof(char))
 683:     _empty_char_arr(res.digits)
 684:     for i in range(large_len-1, -1, -1):
 685:         res.digits[N_DIGITS_I-i] = large[large_len-1-i]-ZERO
 686:     
 687:     free(large_copy)
 688:     for i in range(small_len):
 689:         res.digits[N_DIGITS+i] = small[i]-ZERO
 690:     free(small_copy)
 691:     
 692:     #memcpy(&res.digits, digits, sizeof(digits))
 693:     return res
 694: 
 695: cdef _cydecimal _decimal_from_int_cy(int first) noexcept nogil:
 696:     cdef iterable_t i
 697:     cdef unsigned char large_lim = <int>floor(log10(cabs(first))+1)
 698:     cdef _cydecimal res
 699:     res.exp = 0
 700:     memcpy(&res.digits, <char*>calloc(MAX_LENGTH, sizeof(char)), MAX_LENGTH)
 701:     # test: 8204.172
 702:     for i in range(N_DIGITS):
 703:         if i <= large_lim:
 704:             res.digits[N_DIGITS_I-i] = cabs(first)%10
 705:             first = first//10
 706:         else:
 707:             break
 708:     if first < 0:
 709:         res.digits[N_DIGITS_I-i] = -(res.digits[N_DIGITS_I-i])
 710:     return res
 711: 
 712: cdef _cydecimal _norm_decimal_from_int_cy(int first) noexcept nogil:
 713:     cdef iterable_t i
 714:     cdef unsigned char large_lim = <int>floor(log10(cabs(first))+1)
 715:     cdef _cydecimal res
 716:     res.exp = 0
 717:     memcpy(&res.digits, <char*>calloc(MAX_LENGTH, sizeof(char)), MAX_LENGTH)
 718:     # test: 8204.172
 719:     for i in range(N_DIGITS):
 720:         if i <= large_lim:
 721:             res.digits[N_DIGITS_I-i] = cabs(first)%10
 722:             first = first//10
 723:         else:
 724:             break
 725:     if first < 0:
 726:         res.digits[N_DIGITS_I-i] = -(res.digits[N_DIGITS_I-i])
 727:     _normalize_digits(&res, False)
 728:     return res
 729: 
 730: cdef _cydecimal _norm_decimal_from_double_cy(const double first) noexcept nogil:  # use if want to normalize to (x>=0)&&(x<=0) (no precision part)
 731:     cdef double temp=first
 732:     cdef iterable_t i
 733:     cdef unsigned char large_lim
 734:     cdef _cydecimal res
 735:     res.exp = 0
 736:     memcpy(&res.digits, <char*>calloc(MAX_LENGTH, sizeof(char)), MAX_LENGTH)
 737:     while (ceil(fabs(temp))!=fabs(temp)):
 738:         postincrement(res.exp)
 739:         temp = temp*10
 740:     large_lim = (<iterable_t>floor(log10(fabs(temp))+1))
 741:     if (large_lim > N_DIGITS):
 742:         large_lim = N_DIGITS_I
 743:     # test: 8204.172
 744:     for i in range(large_lim):
 745:         res.digits[N_DIGITS_I-i] = <char>fmod(temp, 10)
 746:         temp = (temp*0.1)
 747:     return res
 748: 
 749: cdef _cydecimal _decimal_from_double_cy(const double first) noexcept nogil:  # use if there is enough PRECISION storage (will be truncated if no)
 750:     cdef double large = floor(first), small, temp
 751:     small = first-large  # decimal portion
 752:     temp = large
 753:     cdef iterable_t i
 754:     cdef unsigned char large_lim = (<unsigned char>floor(log10(fabs(large))+1))
 755:     if (large_lim > N_DIGITS):
 756:         large_lim = N_DIGITS_I
 757:     cdef _cydecimal res
 758:     res.exp = 0
 759:     memcpy(&res.digits, <char*>calloc(MAX_LENGTH, sizeof(char)), MAX_LENGTH)
 760:     # test: 8204.172
 761:     for i in range(large_lim):
 762:         res.digits[N_DIGITS_I-i] = <char>fmod(temp, 10)
 763:         temp = (temp*0.1)
 764:     temp = small
 765:     i = N_PRECISION
 766:     while (fabs(temp)!=ceil(fabs(temp))):
 767:         temp = (temp*10)
 768:         res.digits[i] = <char>fmod(floor(temp), 10)
 769:         postincrement(i)
 770:         if i > MAX_INDICE:
 771:             break
 772:     return res
 773: 
 774: cdef _cydecimal _add_decimals_cy(_cydecimal first, _cydecimal second) noexcept nogil:
 775:     cdef iterable_t i, x
 776:     if first.exp > second.exp:  # bring up second, without _normalize as we have to normalize after precision and leading zero normalization ANYWAY
 777:         x = first.exp-second.exp
 778:         _left_shift_digits(&second, x)  # bring up value
 779:     elif second.exp > first.exp:
 780:         x = second.exp-first.exp
 781:         _left_shift_digits(&first, x)  # bring up value
 782:     cdef char overflow = 0, res = 0, z, y
 783:     for i in range(MAX_INDICE, -1, -1):
 784:         y = second.digits[i]
 785:         z = first.digits[i]
 786:         if ((overflow!=0) or (x!=0 or y!=0)):
 787:             res = z + y + overflow
 788:             overflow = res
 789:             if overflow > 9:
 790:                 overflow = overflow%10
 791:             first.digits[i] = overflow  # get the last digit
 792:             overflow = <char>((res-overflow)*0.1)
 793:     return first
 794: 
 795: cdef _cydecimal _subtract_decimals_cy(_cydecimal first, _cydecimal second) noexcept nogil:
 796:     cdef iterable_t i, index = 0, t
 797:     cdef char x, y, res=0
 798:     cdef bool small = False, negate=False
 799:     cdef _cydecimal temp
 800:     cdef char[MAX_LENGTH] data
 801:     if first.exp > second.exp:  # bring up second, without _normalize as we have to normalize after precision and leading zero normalization ANYWAY
 802:         _left_shift_digits(&second, first.exp-second.exp)  # bring up value
 803:     elif second.exp > first.exp:
 804:         _left_shift_digits(&first, second.exp-first.exp)  # bring up value
 805:         temp = second
 806:         second = first
 807:         first = temp # swap
 808:         negate = True
 809:     elif _less_than_digits(first, second):
 810:         temp = second
 811:         second = first
 812:         first = temp # swap
 813:         negate = True
 814:     elif _eq_digits(first, second):  # is this really worth it?
 815:         data = <char*>calloc(MAX_LENGTH, sizeof(char))
 816:         return _decimal(&data, 0, False)
 817:         free(data)
 818:     for i in range(MAX_INDICE, -1, -1):
 819:         y = second.digits[i]
 820:         x = first.digits[i]
 821:         if ((res!=0) or (x!=0 or y!=0)):
 822:             x = x - res
 823:             y = y
 824: 
 825:             small = x < y
 826:             if small:x+=10
 827:             res = (x) - y 
 828:             if res > 9:
 829:                 res = ((res)%10)
 830:             else:
 831:                 res=res
 832:             if negate:
 833:                 if res!=0:
 834:                     index=i
 835:             first.digits[i] = res  # always positive
 836: 
 837:             res = small
 838:             #print(overflow, 'overflow', res, small, (<char>small), <char>((res-overflow)*0.1), x, y)
 839:     if negate:
 840:         first.digits[index] = -first.digits[index]
 841:     return first
 842:     
 843: cdef _cydecimal _mult_decimals_cy(const _cydecimal_ptr first, const _cydecimal_ptr second) noexcept nogil:
 844:     cdef exponent_t i, j, place_val=0
 845:     cdef bool negate = first.negative ^ second.negative  # 492.665453712
 846:     cdef unsigned char overflow, x, y
 847:     cdef _cydecimal result = _empty_decimal()
 848:     _normalize_digits(first, True)
 849:     _normalize_digits(second, True)
 850:     result.exp = first.exp + second.exp
 851:     result.negative = negate
 852: 
 853:     for i in range(N_DIGITS_I, -1, -1):
 854:         overflow = 0
 855:         x = first.digits[i]
 856:         if first.negative:
 857:             if x > 9:
 858:                 x = -x
 859: 
 860:         if x != 0:
 861:             for j in range(N_DIGITS_I, -1, -1):
 862:                 y = second.digits[j]
 863:                 if first.negative:
 864:                     if y > 9:  # overflow lmao
 865:                         y = -y
 866: 
 867:                 if y == 0 and overflow == 0:
 868:                     continue
 869: 
 870:                 overflow = (x * y) + overflow + result.digits[j-place_val]
 871:                 if (overflow > 9):
 872:                     result.digits[j-place_val] = overflow % 10
 873:                     overflow = <unsigned char>(overflow*0.1)  # Integer division for carry-over
 874:                 else:
 875:                     result.digits[j-place_val] = overflow
 876:                     overflow=0
 877: 
 878:         postincrement(place_val)
 879:             # This line adds the carry-over to the next digit
 880: 
 881:     if negate:
 882:         for i in range(MAX_LENGTH):
 883:             if result.digits[i] != 0:
 884:                 result.digits[i] = -result.digits[i]
 885:                 break
 886:     _normalize_digits(&result, False)
 887:     return result
 888:                 
 889:     '''
